intro: Merremia cissoides f. tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, tomentose stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. This species is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooming habit.
